intro: Luzula sudetica var. nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses and related plants. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in dense, dark green foliage. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that bear small, greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
